item.detail_t: The beginning of the Web as a publicly available service on the Internet arrived on August 6, 1991, when Berners-Lee published the first-ever website. Fittingly, the site was about the World Wide Web project, describing the Web and how to use it. Hosted at CERN on Berners-Lee’s NeXT computer, the site’s URL was http://info.cern.ch.
item.detail_html: Former political prisoner Nelson Mandela was inaugurated as president of South Africa. Mandela had won the first free elections in South Africa despite attempts by various political foes to deter the outcome.
